{"step_by_step_thinking": "Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency is a genetic disorder that can cause lung disease in adults and liver disease in adults and children. Alpha-1 antitrypsin (A1AT) is a protein that protects the lungs. The liver usually makes the protein, and releases it into the bloodstream. With A1AT deficiency, the liver doesn't make enough A1AT, so the lungs have less protection. This can lead to lung damage. The enzyme elastase, which is released by neutrophils and alveolar macrophages, can break down elastin, a key component of lung tissue. In a healthy individual, A1AT inhibits elastase, preventing lung damage. However, in an individual with A1AT deficiency, there is insufficient A1AT to inhibit elastase, leading to unchecked elastase activity and lung damage.", "answer_choice": "D. Elastase"}
